Message.Title: No configured mechanical units
Message.Description: The instance of configuration type has no mechanical unit argument.
Message.Consequences: It will not be possible to perform any actions against the motion system, i.e. execute RAPID move instructions.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the controller.

Message.Title: Not connected Mechanical Unit Group
Message.Description: There is no Motion task connected with the Mechanical Unit Group .
Message.Consequences: It will not be possible to use the mechanical units that belong to this group.
Message.Causes: The cause of this error can be a missing RAPID task instance in the Controller domain of the configuration or a task that has not been configured as a Motion task.
Message.Actions:
1. Add a Motion task instance that is connected to the Mechanical Unit Group.
2. Change an existing non Motion task to a Motion task.
3. Remove the Mechanical Unit Group.
4. Check for misspelled names.

Message.Title: Confusing configuration of system parameters.
Message.Description: There is a mixture of old and new structure of type System Misc.
Message.Consequences: It is possible that not the correct parameters are configured.
Message.Causes: Configuration of old and new structure has been loaded into the system.
Message.Actions:
1. Check that the correct parameters are configured.
2. Update the parameters in System Misc with correct values.
3. Save the Controller domain and replace the old config file.

Message.Title: Failed to read configuration data for regain distance
Message.Description: The system failed to read the configuration data for the type <>. The regain distance is the limit when the system will warn before a start with regain movement.
Message.Consequences: Default value for the regain distance will be used.
Message.Causes:
-The sys.cfg file loaded into the system does not contain any regain distance information.
-No sys.cfg file has been loaded due to file errors.
Message.Actions: 1) Load a new sys.cfg file and restart the system

Message.Title: A default Mechanical Unit Group is used
Message.Description: The configuration of task has no connection to . The attribute is required in a multimove system and is missing.
Message.Consequences: The task performs no movement by the mechanical unit, but can read motion data. The RAPID functions may fail, if they read motion data and is connected to the wrong mechanical unit. The Mechanical Unit Group in has been connected to the task.
Message.Causes:
-The attribute was not specified when the configuration was created.
-The configuration file could have been created in a non-multi move system.
Message.Actions: 1) Make sure the correct Mechanical Unit Group is connected to the task.

Message.Title: Failed to read configuration data.
Message.Description: The system failed to read the configuration data for the type <>.
Message.Consequences: Hotedit or modpos will not be possible.
Message.Causes:
-The sys.cfg file loaded into the system does not contain hotedit and modpos information.
-No sys.cfg file has been loaded due to file errors.
Message.Actions: Load a new sys.cfg file and restart the system

Message.Title: No Motion Planner connected to mechanical unit
Message.Description: The mechanical unit has no Motion Planner connected.
Message.Consequences: It is not possible to use this mechanical unit in any operations such as calibration or activation.
Message.Causes: The cause of this error is probably an error in the configuration.
Message.Actions: Check the Motion and/or Controller configuration.

Message.Title: Error when recreating path after power fail
Message.Description: The path wasn't successfully recreated.
Message.Consequences: The Program Pointer must be moved before restarting the program. It's recommended to move the robot to a safe position though the robot might not follow the original path when restarted.
Message.Causes: A number of errors may cause this. Faults causing the system to go to status SYS FAIL will generally also cause path recreate after powerfail to fail.
Message.Actions:
1) Check other event log messages occurring at the same time to determine the actual cause.
2) Fix the cause of the fault.
3) Move the robot to a safe position before restarting. The robot may not follow the original path.

Message.Title: Start rejected
Message.Description:
Start/restart of program, via System IO, was rejected.
The reason is that write access is held by
using

Message.Title: Start at main rejected
Message.Description:
Start of program at main, via System IO, was rejected.
The reason is that write access is held by
using

Message.Title: Manual interrupt rejected
Message.Description:
Manual interrupt of program, via System IO, was rejected.
The reason is that write access is held by
using

Message.Title: Load and start rejected
Message.Description:
Load and start of program, via System IO, was rejected.
The reason is that write access is held by
using

Message.Title: Motors On and Start rejected.
Message.Description:
Motors On and Start/restart of program, via System IO, was rejected.
The reason is that write access is held by
using

Message.Title: Load rejected
Message.Description:
Load of program via System IO, was rejected.
The reason is that write access is held by
using

Message.Title: Manual interrupt rejected
Message.Description:
Manual interrupt of program, via System IO, was rejected in task .
Manual interrupt is not allowed during synchronized movement.

Message.Title: Manual interrupt rejected
Message.Description:
Manual interrupt of program, via System IO, was rejected in task .
The interrupt is connected to , which is not a valid RAPID procedure.
Message.Consequences: will not be executed.
Message.Causes:
1. does not exist.
2. is not a procedure (PROC) that takes zero (0) parameters.
Message.Actions: Make sure that is an existing procedure (PROC) that takes zero (0) parameters.

Message.Title: Automatic Mode Rejected
Message.Description: A stopped static/semistatic task (alias background task) could not be started when automatic mode was requested.
Message.Consequences: The system can not enter automatic mode.
Message.Causes: A stopped static/semistatic task could not be started.
Message.Actions:
1) Switch back to manual mode.
2) Make sure that all static/semistatic tasks has a program/module containing the configured production entry.
3) Make sure that no static/semistatic task has any syntax errors.
4) Switch back to automatic mode and confirm.

Message.Title: Static/Semistatic task started
Message.Description: At least on static/semistatic task (alias background task) was not executing after startup in automatic mode.
Message.Consequences: Execution was started in at least one static/semistatic task.
Message.Causes: System was switched to automatic mode during warm start.
Message.Actions:
None, system has automatically reset debug settings.
To keep debug settings in auto:
1) Switch back to auto mode
2) Set system parameter Controller/Auto Condition Reset/AllDebugSettings/Reset to NO.
3) Switch back to automatic mode and confirm.
4) For more info, see the Technical Reference Manual - System Parameters.

Message.Title: Debug Settings In Auto
Message.Description: A static/semistatic task (alias background task) has been stopped.
Message.Consequences:
The static/semistatic task will not be started.
System will not be in full production mode in auto.
Message.Actions:
For full production mode:
1) Switch back to manual mode.
2) Set system parameter Controller/Auto Condition Reset/AllDebugSettings/Reset to Yes.
3) Switch back to automatic mode and confirm.
4) For more info, see the Technical Reference Manual - System Parameters.

Message.Title: Too many CFG instances
Message.Description: There are too many instances of type in topic .
Message.Consequences: The wrong instance may be used and cause unexpected behavior.
Message.Causes: There are multiple instances of of type in topic .
Message.Actions: Remove all instances but one.

Message.Title: Automatic Mode Rejected
Message.Description: An active RAPID Spy session could not be deactivated when automatic mode was requested.
Message.Consequences: The system cannot enter automatic mode.
Message.Causes: RAPID Spy could not be deactivated.
Message.Actions:
1) Switch back to manual mode.
2) Use an external client, e.g. RobotStudio, to deactivate RAPID Spy.
3) Switch back to automatic mode and confirm.

Message.Title: RAPID Spy deactivated
Message.Description: RAPID Spy was deactivated after startup in automatic mode.
Message.Consequences: RAPID Spy was deactivated.
Message.Causes: System was switched to automatic mode during warm start.
Message.Actions:
None, system has automatically reset debug settings.
To keep debug settings in auto:
1) Switch back to manual mode
2) Set system parameter Controller / Auto Condition Reset / AllDebugSettings / Reset to NO.
3) Switch back to automatic mode and confirm.
4) For more info, see the Technical Reference Manual - System Parameters.

Message.Title: Debug Settings In Auto
Message.Description: RAPID Spy is active.
Message.Consequences:
RAPID Spy will not be deactivated.
System will not be in full production mode in auto.
Message.Actions:
For full production mode:
1) Switch back to manual mode.
2) Set system parameter Controller / Auto Condition Reset / AllDebugSettings / Reset to Yes.
3) Switch back to automatic mode and confirm.
4) For more info, see the Technical Reference Manual - System Parameters.

Message.Title: Automatic Mode Rejected
Message.Description: An active Profi Energy device could not be reseted when automatic mode was requested.
Message.Consequences: The system cannot enter automatic mode.
Message.Causes: A Profi Energy device could not be reseted.
Message.Actions:
1) Switch back to manual mode.
2) Reset the Profi Energy device.
3) Switch back to automatic mode and confirm.

Message.Title: Profi Energy device reseted
Message.Description: A Profi Energy device was reseted after startup in automatic mode.
Message.Consequences: A Profi Energy device was reseted.
Message.Causes: System was switched to automatic mode during warm start.
Message.Actions:
None, system has automatically reset debug settings.
To keep debug settings in auto:
1) Switch back to manual mode
2) Set system parameter Controller / Auto Condition Reset / AllDebugSettings / Reset to NO.
3) Switch back to automatic mode and confirm.
4) For more info, see the Technical Reference Manual - System Parameters.

Message.Title: Debug Settings In Auto
Message.Description: A Profi Energy device is in pause mode.
Message.Consequences:
A Profi Energy device will not be reseted.
System will not be in full production mode in auto.
Message.Actions:
For full production mode:
1) Switch back to manual mode.
2) Set system parameter Controller / Auto Condition Reset / AllDebugSettings / Reset to Yes.
3) Switch back to automatic mode and confirm.
4) For more info, see the Technical Reference Manual - System Parameters.

Message.Title: Failed to initialize FW upgrade framework
Message.Description: The firmware upgrade framework for hardware boards could not be initialized
Message.Consequences: No firmware upgrade of hardware boards will be performed
Message.Causes: An invalid xml file in the controller installation:
Message.Actions:
For developers:
- Correct the file. Use the hw_compatibility.xsd schema to verify.
For other users:
- Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Failed to initialize firmware patch
Message.Description: Failed to initialize the firmware patch handling for hardware boards.
Message.Consequences: No firmware patches for hardware boards will be applied
Message.Causes: The firmware patch file was invalid:
Message.Actions: Correct the patch file. Use the schema hw_compatibility.xsd to verify.

Message.Title: Multiple firmware upgrade restarts
Message.Description: A new restart to firmware upgrade mode was ordered after two consecutive upgrade restarts.
Message.Consequences: No further restart to firmware upgrade mode was performed.
Message.Causes: Firmware upgrade of a hardware board has most likely failed. The board's firmware or hardware may be corrupt.
Message.Actions: Check the event log for previous error messages.

Message.Title: SC CBC Speed exceeded
Message.Description: Cyclic Brake Check (CBC) speed limit is exceeded in Safety Controller (SC) on Mechanical unit . Either CBC test interval has expired or a previous Brake Check failed.
Message.Actions: Decrease speed and execute Brake check

Message.Title: SC Not synchronized
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) is not synchronized with supervised Mechanical units.
Message.Actions: Move all Mechanical units supervised by Safety Controller to the synchronization positions defined in the Safety Configuration.

Message.Title: SC Synchronized
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) is now synchronized to supervised Mechanical units. Safety supervision can be used.

Message.Title: SC Wrong Sync. Position
Message.Description: The positions of the supervised Mechanical units do not match the synchronization positions defined in the Safety Configuration for Safety Controller (SC) on axis .
Message.Actions:
- Check that all supervised Mechanical units are positioned at the configured synchronization position.
- Check that the synchronization switch is working properly.
- Check that motor calibration and revolution counters are updated and correct.
- Check that the synchronization position in the Safety Configuration is correct.
- Check for configuration error.
- Download Motor calibration values.
- Check if axis 4 or 6 is configured as independent, if YES, check that the EPS configuration is configured likewise.

Message.Title: SC Servo-Lag Limit exceeded
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) detected a too big difference between the ordered and actual position, for Mechanical unit on axis .
Message.Actions:
- Check for collision.
- If using external axis, check Servo Lag settings in the Safety Configuration.
- If using Soft Servo, Check that the Operational Safety Range (OSR) Tolerance in the Safety Configuration is not set too low
- Verify that revolution counters are updated.
- Check for communication problems to the Main Computer, Axis Computer or the Serial Measurement Board.
- Check if tool weight is correctly defined.

Message.Title: SC Incorrect Position Value
Message.Description: Incorrect position value from Serial Measurement Board detected by Safety Controller (SC) on Mechanical unit .
Message.Actions:
- Check resolver and resolver connections.
- Replace Serial Measurement Board.
- Replace resolver.

Message.Title: SC Reference Data Timeout
Message.Description: The Robot Controller has stopped sending reference data to Safety Controller (SC) .
Message.Actions:
1. Check previous error logs for possible causes.
2. Restart System.

Message.Title: SC Changed Safety Configuration
Message.Description: The Safety Configuration for Safety Controller (SC) has changed contents or doesn't fit with the used hardware.
Message.Causes:
- New Safety Configuration has been downloaded, the normal case.
- The configuration doesn't fit with the used hardware. Typically when the elog with request for new pin code is repeated.
- Corrupt Safety Configuration. Typically when the elog with request for new pin code is repeated.
Message.Actions:
1. Check for new elog messages that indicates if a new Safety Configuration has been downloaded.
2. If no new Safety Configuration has been downloaded and this elog comes after a warmstart, download a new Safety Configuration to the Safety Controller.
3. Create and download a new Safety Configuration if this elog comes after every warmstart and there is a request for new pin code again.

Message.Title: SC Internal Failure
Message.Description: Internal Failure in Safety Controller (SC) .
Message.Actions:
- Check Safety Controller cabling.
- Check Safety Controller health on LED
- Replace Safety Controller if remaining error

Message.Title: SC Input/Output Failure
Message.Description: I/O Error on Safety Controller (SC) .
Message.Actions:
- Check Safety Controller cabling.
- Check Safety Controller health.
Warm start Robot Controller, after performing recommended actions.

Message.Title: SC Safety Configuration not found
Message.Description: Failed to retrieve Safety Configuration for Safety Controller (SC) .
Message.Actions:
- Warm start Robot Controller.
- Download a Safety Configuration to the SC.
- Reinstall System.

Message.Title: SC Robot Configuration not found
Message.Description: Failed to retrieve Robot Configuration for Safety Controller (SC) .
Message.Actions:
- Warm start Robot Controller.
- Reinstall System.

Message.Title: SC Calibration Offset not found
Message.Description: Failed to retrieve Motor Calibration offsets for Safety Controller (SC) .
Message.Actions: Download new Calibration offsets to the SC.

Message.Title: SC Safety Configuration downloaded
Message.Description: Download of Safety Configuration was successful for Safety Controller (SC) .

Message.Title: SC OSR Limit exceeded
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) detected a too big difference between the ordered and actual position inside Operational Safety Range (OSR) , for Mechanical unit on axis .
Message.Actions:
- Check for collision.
- Check that Operational Safety Range (OSR) Tolerance in the Safety Configuration is not set too low.
- Synchronize the Safety Controller, if the revolution counters have been updated since last synchronization.

Message.Title: SC SAS Speed exceeded
Message.Description: Safe Axis Speed (SAS) violation on Mechanical unit Axis on Safety Controller (SC)
Message.Actions: Decrease speed on Axis

Message.Title: SC Input/Output Failure
Message.Description:
I/O Error on Safety Controller (SC) I/O Type
Type 1: Input
Type 2: Output
Message.Causes:
- Wrong connection to I/O terminals on SC
- Two channel I/O mismatch
Message.Actions:
- Check SC cabling.
- Check SC health.
Warm start Robot Controller, after performing recommended actions.

Message.Title: SC STS speed exceeded
Message.Description: Safe reduced Tool Speed (STS) in Safety Controller (SC) on Mechanical unit too high. Cause .
Message.Causes:
1. Tool0 speed
2. Elbow speed
3. Tool speed
4. Additional axis speed
Message.Actions: Reduce tool speed.

Message.Title: SC STZ violation
Message.Description:
Safe Tool Zone (STZ) is violated on Mechanical unit .
Tool was active.
Cause
Message.Causes:
1. Exceeded speed
2. Wrong tool position
3. Wrong tool orientation
4. Wrong elbow position
11. Wrong tool point 1 position
12. Wrong tool point 2 position
13. Wrong tool point 3 position
14. Wrong tool point 4 position
15. Wrong tool point 5 position
16. Wrong tool point 6 position
17. Wrong tool point 7 position
18. Wrong tool point 8 position
Message.Actions:
- Reduce speed
- Move Robot tool to safe position
- Adjust tool orientation

Message.Title: SC SAR violation
Message.Description: Safe Axis Range (SAR) is violated on Mechanical unit Axis
Message.Actions: Move Mechanical unit to safe position

Message.Title: SC Synchronization Pre-warning
Message.Description: Synchronization required for Mechanical units supervised by Safety Controller (SC) in less than hour(s).
Message.Actions: Perform synchronization before the time limit expires.

Message.Title: SC Synchronization Timeout
Message.Description: Synchronization time limit expired for Safety Controller (SC) . Last synchronization was hours ago.
Message.Actions: Perform synchronization.

Message.Title: SC New Safety Configuration
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) has received a new Safety Configuration. A new PIN-code is needed to activate.
Message.Actions:
1. Log in as a user with Safety Configuration grants.
2. Enter new PIN-Code for the Safety Controller in the Control Panel.

Message.Title: SC Dual Computer mismatch
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) have had conflicting values for a Safety Output for too long.
Message.Consequences: The Safety Controller has entered a Safe State and issue an error after 10 minutes of internal mismatch, if recommended actions are not performed.
Message.Causes:
- The Mechanical unit have been parked at a position on, or close to, a supervised or monitored function limit for too long time.
- Internal computation error in Safety Controller.
Message.Actions: Move all Mechanical units’ axes and tools well inside or outside monitored and supervised function limits.

Message.Title: SC I/O Supply Failure
Message.Description: I/O supply voltage level for Safety Controller (SC) is out of range.
Message.Causes: Either the voltage is out of limits or the voltage is missing.
Message.Actions:
1. Connect 24V supply with correct voltage level to I/O supply terminals.
2. Warm start Robot Controller.

Message.Title: SC Synchronization rejected
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) is not correctly configured for synchronization.
Message.Causes:
- Safety Configuration PIN is not set or is incorrect.
- Safety Configuration is empty.
- Safety Configuration is corrupt or missing.
- Safety Controller connected to the wrong SMB bus.
- I/O Power supply missing.
Message.Actions: Verify and check possible causes

Message.Title: SC Disabled
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) is disabled.
Message.Consequences: All safety supervision has been disabled in the Safety Controller. Risk for Safety hazards.
Message.Actions: Download a Safety Configuration to the Safety Controller.

Message.Title: SC SMB Communication Failure
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) failed to communicate with Serial Measurement Board (SMB).
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure that the cabling from SMB to Safety Controller is connected to the right SMB connector and functional.
2. Restart System.

Message.Title: SC Main Supply Failure
Message.Description: The main power supply voltage for Safety Controller (SC) is out of range.
Message.Causes: Either the voltage is out of limit or the voltage is missing.
Message.Actions:
1. Check Safety Controller cabling.
2. Check voltage from power supply.
3. Warm start Robot Controller.

Message.Title: SC Additional Axis missing
Message.Description: An Additional Axis that is supervised by Safety Controller (SC) is no longer present in the System Configuration.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the supervised Additional Axis, or Download a Safety Configuration without supervision of the Additional Axis.

Message.Title: SC SST violation
Message.Description: Safe Stand Still (SST) in Safety Controller (SC) is violated on Mechanical unit Axis .
Message.Actions:
- Verify RAPID program
- Verify process equipment
- Check that movement is not ongoing when SST is active
- Check previous elog messages

Message.Title: SC OVR active
Message.Description:
Override Operation (OVR) active on Safety Controller (SC)
SafeMove will stop the robot after approximately 20 minutes with OVR active.
Speed is limited to 250 mm/s or 18 degrees/s.
Message.Actions: Deactivate signal connected to OVR input

Message.Title: SC OVR time out
Message.Description: Override Operation (OVR) has been active too long time on Safety Controller (SC) .
Message.Actions:
1. Warmstart Robot Controller 2. Toggle signal connected to OVR input
3. Activate Confirm stop by pressing Motors On push button
4. Jog Robot back into working area
5. Deactivate signal connected to OVR input

Message.Title: SC CBC soon required
Message.Description: Cyclic Brake Check (CBC) required in less than hours.
Message.Actions: Perform a Brake Check before the time limit expires.

Message.Title: SC CBC needs to be done
Message.Description: Cyclic Brake Check (CBC) time limit expired in Safety Controller (SC)or last Brake Check failed.
Message.Actions: Perform a Brake Check.

Message.Title: SC Too low brake torque
Message.Description: Too low brake torque in Safety Controller (SC) on Mechanical unit axis .
Message.Causes:
- Axis has not been tested.
- Worn out brake(s).
Message.Actions:
- Check that the failing axis is activated
- If failing axis is activated replace brake(s)as soon as possible.

Message.Title: SC CBC interrupted or incorrect
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) has detected that the last Cyclic Brake Check (CBC) on Mechanical unit was interrupted or incorrect.
Message.Actions:
- Check previous elogs.
- Perform a new Brake Check only if needed, typically if elog 20485 also has been displayed.

Message.Title: SC Unsynchronized speed exceeded
Message.Description: Exceeded Axis speed when Safety Controller (SC) was unsynchronized.
Message.Actions: Jog Mechanical unit to synch position with low axis speed. Reduce speed to 250 mm/s or 18 degrees/s.

Message.Title: SC Unsynchronized time limit expired
Message.Description: Available time to move the Robot when unsynchronized has expired for Safety Controller (SC) .
Message.Actions:
1. Do a Confirm stop by pressing the Motors ON push button or activate System input
2. Synchronize SC .

Message.Title: SC has been disabled
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) has been disabled and no supervision functions are active.
Message.Causes: Either a C-start has been performed or it's the first startup of SC.
Message.Actions: Download a Configuration to SC .

Message.Title: SC OVR Speed exceeded
Message.Description: Override (OVR) Speed limit exceeded on Mechanical unit .
Message.Causes: If Override (OVR) is active, then OVR speed limitations will be active
Message.Actions:
- Decrease speed.
- Deactivate OVR.

Message.Title: SC Override active during startup
Message.Description: Override digital input was active during startup on SC

Message.Title: SC SST violation in Brake test
Message.Description: Movement detected during Brake test on Safety Controller (SC) Mechanical unit Axis
Message.Causes:
- Interrupted braketest.
- Worn out Brakes.
Message.Actions:
- Restart CBC.
- Replace Brake.
